title: Got hit with a hard match up and fed but....
body: I can't see the counterplay, I know feeding is on me but being an assassin rengar against vi and ramus top is really hard to deal with... especially if they play super aggressive. Any suggestions as to what I could have done would be great !

replies.body:
Don't play assassin Rengar top.

Problem fixed.
I have nothing to say, I was really asking for help to actually improve and all I get is your troll shit

Build botrk.

Vi does % max hp damage every 3 autos and gets a shield up to every 15 or 18 seconds or so based on her max HP when she uses an ability so she has huge incentive to build HP and will most likely build Trinity then tank or even sunfire and tank or just straight tank.

Cutlass will help you deal with her E harass and help you lifesteal back up if she lands her Q's. She'll push lane in most cases if she harasses you making her vulnerable to ganks.

Rammus is generally GG atm just because the game is so much more aggressive and Rammus really wrecks so much more mid-game than he used to. I suggest taking cleanse if they have a ramus or building a QSS although in this case because top laner is AD that's a lot of wasted stats.

Some games are just GG because of picks etc and there's little you can do about it.

I've seen a Jax in competitive play get destroyed by an Irelia to the point where he actually just sat behind minions dancing.

There isn't always something you can do but another idea is to build Armor because this will cut down a lot of Vi's damage and shes unlikely to build armor pen (She gets shred every 3 autos so go for hit and run trades) [also bait out her Q etc if possible, she has high mana costs] and this will basically punish her for building tank. On top of this, wards would help even if they're a bit annoying to place because you're likely to die placing them or miss out on too much lane control etc.

Rengar top sucks in my opinion because he is insanely lane control dependent or just ends up farming with bola strikes and if you play aggressive early he gets destroyed so keep this in mind as people are likely to play aggressive early and if you make it to late/mid game its easier to get stacks up on your skills and on top of this things like your Roar will give you more stats and heal more allowing easier laning (rengar power spikes from skills around level 7-8) - also consider maxing Roar in tough matchups to utilize its early sustain and stat bonuses.

Vi's a strong top laner but she's better in the jungle because she is a strong flanker and has decent CC (mainly at 6) and has a decent late game so try to go aggressive around level 4, otherwise level 7-8.

She power spikes at 3 and 4 then at 7-8 so you have to play smart and keep in mind Rammus will clear around 3:30 so sit back at this point (Sit back at 3:30 most of the time if you are blue side and they're a blue then red jungler as this is about the time they clear) and keep in mind Rammus's gank patterns are consistently and early because of his kit and also remember his powerball damage is pretty hectic and hes hard to escape from so consider items like mercs in laning phase to escape his CC - it will also reduce his damage.

Play especially safe early vs that matchup.

Look you aren't going to get matchups you enjoy in top lane with an assassin Rengar.

It's the same problem Zed tops have, your pretty much useless unless your opponent is bronze 5.

If you want something cheese for top lane, go riven.

Once you start losing, give up farm to avoid dying. Wait for the wave to get to your tower and get what you can, and in the meantime either do jungle camps or try to gank other lanes. Once you get level 6 gank mid and bot repeatedly and return top in between ults only to catch waves at tower. The best way to counter a fed top laner is usually by getting your teammates/you fed in other lanes, not by begging for jungle help or trying to outplay him on your own.

Yeah but their pushing power is so strong that they don't need to leave lane without heaps of pressure, and If I leave it is likely my tower will be gone by the time I get back. (p.s, useful tips. The game was a pretty big landslide in terms of a loss but if another game is more balanced then ill definitely do that)

You can't win 1v2 unless you overlevel your enemies then your jungler ganks really.... LCS players usually just stay safe, let the tower die and try grab as much cs as possible, in your case use ebola strike.
or you play morde and turn that 1v2 into a 2v1
juke around the turret and ult 2ez
ty I tried but my jg was more interested in the 1v2 botlane for easy kills, he ended up feeding too

Playing Rengar can be a little difficult vsing tanks especially if it's a duo lane. What I tend to do when vsing any sort of tank (Garen, Shen etc.) is take full Armor Pen runes because I normally don't expect to win hard early game, and Arm. Pen runes scale so well into the late game (if you build ghost blade, lw and all that other good stuff) when vsing heavy armor champs. Another thing I do is finish off hydra before building a bruit because in a pressure lane you'll need help sustaining. Also people normally tend to use EMP Q during any match up (from what i've seen.. but im low silver so yeah) which vsing someone like Rammas is counter productive, try to use EMP W for the HP and try to hit the enemy champ with it at the same time. Other then that just play safe under turrent till level 6 and then go gank other lanes because you'll lose the tower regardless so if you roam at least you'll be positively (hopefully) impacting other lanes and helping them scale. Hope I helped :D
If you get counter picked, take TP instead of ignite. Farm til 6. Ult Botlane and kill enemy ADC. TP back top if necessary. Repeat until enemy ADC has rage quit.
call top.. be prepared for a duo on the occasion

I am tbh, but two single target lockdown tanks and one as infamously powerful as vi is instant death for an assassin top...
I can deal with one quite easily but with ramus/vi having each other to back them up really sucks (If it was a squishy and a tank things would be different)
